trans-unit.source: Azure Data Catalog terminology
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Catalog terminology

trans-unit.source: An introduction to concepts and terms used in Azure Data Catalog documentation.
trans-unit.target: An introduction to concepts and terms used in Azure Data Catalog documentation.

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Catalog terminology
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Catalog terminology

trans-unit.source: Catalog
trans-unit.target: Catalog

trans-unit.source: The Azure Data Catalog is a cloud-based metadata repository in which data sources and data assets can be registered.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Data Catalog is a cloud-based metadata repository in which data sources and data assets can be registered.

trans-unit.source: The catalog serves as a central storage location for structural metadata extracted from data sources and for descriptive metadata added by users.
trans-unit.target: The catalog serves as a central storage location for structural metadata extracted from data sources and for descriptive metadata added by users.

trans-unit.source: Data source
trans-unit.target: Data source

trans-unit.source: A data source is a system or container that manages data assets.
trans-unit.target: A data source is a system or container that manages data assets.

trans-unit.source: Examples include SQL Server databases, Oracle databases, SQL Server Analysis Services databases (tabular or multidimensional) and SQL Server Reporting Services servers.
trans-unit.target: Examples include SQL Server databases, Oracle databases, SQL Server Analysis Services databases (tabular or multidimensional) and SQL Server Reporting Services servers.

trans-unit.source: Data asset
trans-unit.target: Data asset

trans-unit.source: Data assets are objects contained within data sources that can be registered with the catalog.
trans-unit.target: Data assets are objects contained within data sources that can be registered with the catalog.

trans-unit.source: Examples include SQL Server tables and views, Oracle tables and views, SQL Server Analysis Services measures, dimensions and KPIs, and SQL Server Reporting Services reports.
trans-unit.target: Examples include SQL Server tables and views, Oracle tables and views, SQL Server Analysis Services measures, dimensions and KPIs, and SQL Server Reporting Services reports.

trans-unit.source: Data asset location
trans-unit.target: Data asset location

trans-unit.source: The catalog stores the location of a data source or data asset, which can be used to connect to the source using a client application.
trans-unit.target: The catalog stores the location of a data source or data asset, which can be used to connect to the source using a client application.

trans-unit.source: The format and details of the location vary based on the data source type.
trans-unit.target: The format and details of the location vary based on the data source type.

trans-unit.source: For example, a SQL Server table can be identified by its four part name – server name, database name, schema name, object name – while a SQL Server Reporting Services Report can be identified by its URL.
trans-unit.target: For example, a SQL Server table can be identified by its four part name – server name, database name, schema name, object name – while a SQL Server Reporting Services Report can be identified by its URL.

trans-unit.source: Structural metadata
trans-unit.target: Structural metadata

trans-unit.source: Structural metadata is the metadata extracted from a data source that describes the structure of a data asset.
trans-unit.target: Structural metadata is the metadata extracted from a data source that describes the structure of a data asset.

trans-unit.source: This includes the assets location, its object name and type, and additional type-specific characteristics.
trans-unit.target: This includes the assets location, its object name and type, and additional type-specific characteristics.

trans-unit.source: For example, the structural metadata for tables and views includes the names and data types for the object’s columns.
trans-unit.target: For example, the structural metadata for tables and views includes the names and data types for the object’s columns.

trans-unit.source: Descriptive metadata
trans-unit.target: Descriptive metadata

trans-unit.source: Descriptive metadata is metadata that describes the purpose or intent of a data asset.
trans-unit.target: Descriptive metadata is metadata that describes the purpose or intent of a data asset.

trans-unit.source: Typically descriptive metadata is added by catalog users using the Azure Data Catalog portal, but it can also be extracted from the data source during registration.
trans-unit.target: Typically descriptive metadata is added by catalog users using the Azure Data Catalog portal, but it can also be extracted from the data source during registration.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Data Catalog registration tool will extract descriptions from the Description property in SQL Server Analysis Services and SQL Server Reporting Services, and from the [ms_description extended property](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ms190243.aspx) in SQL Server databases, if these properties have been populated with values.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Data Catalog registration tool will extract descriptions from the Description property in SQL Server Analysis Services and SQL Server Reporting Services, and from the [ms_description extended property](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ms190243.aspx) in SQL Server databases, if these properties have been populated with values.

trans-unit.source: Request access
trans-unit.target: Request access

trans-unit.source: A data asset's descriptive metadata can include information on how to request access to the data asset or data source.
trans-unit.target: A data asset's descriptive metadata can include information on how to request access to the data asset or data source.

trans-unit.source: This information is presented with the data asset location, and can include one or more of the following options:
trans-unit.target: This information is presented with the data asset location, and can include one or more of the following options:

trans-unit.source: The email address of the user or team responsible for granting access to the data source.
trans-unit.target: The email address of the user or team responsible for granting access to the data source.

trans-unit.source: The URL of the documented process that users must follow to gain access to the data source.
trans-unit.target: The URL of the documented process that users must follow to gain access to the data source.

trans-unit.source: The URL of an identity and access management tool (such as Microsoft Identity Manager) that can be used to gain access to the data source.
trans-unit.target: The URL of an identity and access management tool (such as Microsoft Identity Manager) that can be used to gain access to the data source.

trans-unit.source: A free-text entry that describes how users can gain access to the data source.
trans-unit.target: A free-text entry that describes how users can gain access to the data source.

trans-unit.source: Previews
trans-unit.target: Previews

trans-unit.source: A preview in Azure Data Catalog is a snapshot of up to 20 records that can be extracted from the data source during registration, and stored in the catalog with the data asset metadata.
trans-unit.target: A preview in Azure Data Catalog is a snapshot of up to 20 records that can be extracted from the data source during registration, and stored in the catalog with the data asset metadata.

trans-unit.source: The preview can help users who discover a data asset better understand its function and purpose.
trans-unit.target: The preview can help users who discover a data asset better understand its function and purpose.

trans-unit.source: In other words, seeing sample data can be more valuable than seeing just the column names and data types.
trans-unit.target: In other words, seeing sample data can be more valuable than seeing just the column names and data types.

trans-unit.source: Previews are only supported for tables and views, and must be explicitly selected by the user during registration.
trans-unit.target: Previews are only supported for tables and views, and must be explicitly selected by the user during registration.

trans-unit.source: User perspective
trans-unit.target: User perspective

trans-unit.source: In Azure Data Catalog, any user can provide descriptive metadata for a registered data asset.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Data Catalog, any user can provide descriptive metadata for a registered data asset.

trans-unit.source: Each user has a distinct perspective on the data and its use.
trans-unit.target: Each user has a distinct perspective on the data and its use.

trans-unit.source: For example, the administrator responsible for a server may provide the details of its service level agreement (SLA) or backup windows; a data steward may provide links to documentation for the business processes the data supports; and an analyst may provide a description in the terms that are most relevant to other analysts, and which can be most valuable to those users who need to discover and understand the data.
trans-unit.target: For example, the administrator responsible for a server may provide the details of its service level agreement (SLA) or backup windows; a data steward may provide links to documentation for the business processes the data supports; and an analyst may provide a description in the terms that are most relevant to other analysts, and which can be most valuable to those users who need to discover and understand the data.

trans-unit.source: Each of these perspectives are inherently valuable, and with Azure Data Catalog each user can provide the information that is meaningful to them, while all users can use that information to understand the data and its purpose.
trans-unit.target: Each of these perspectives are inherently valuable, and with Azure Data Catalog each user can provide the information that is meaningful to them, while all users can use that information to understand the data and its purpose.

trans-unit.source: Expert
trans-unit.target: Expert

trans-unit.source: An expert is a user who has been identified as having an informed “expert” perspective for a data asset.
trans-unit.target: An expert is a user who has been identified as having an informed “expert” perspective for a data asset.

trans-unit.source: Any user can add themselves or another user as an expert for an asset.
trans-unit.target: Any user can add themselves or another user as an expert for an asset.

trans-unit.source: Being listed as an expert does not convey any additional privileges in Azure Data Catalog; it allows users to easily locate those perspectives that are most likely to be useful when reviewing an asset’s descriptive metadata.
trans-unit.target: Being listed as an expert does not convey any additional privileges in Azure Data Catalog; it allows users to easily locate those perspectives that are most likely to be useful when reviewing an asset’s descriptive metadata.

trans-unit.source: Owner
trans-unit.target: Owner

trans-unit.source: An owner is a user who has additional privileges for managing a data asset in Azure Data Catalog.
trans-unit.target: An owner is a user who has additional privileges for managing a data asset in Azure Data Catalog.

trans-unit.source: Users can take ownership of registered data assets, and owners can add other users as co-owners.
trans-unit.target: Users can take ownership of registered data assets, and owners can add other users as co-owners.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Ownership and management are available only in the Standard Edition of Azure Data Catalog.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Ownership and management are available only in the Standard Edition of Azure Data Catalog.

trans-unit.source: Registration
trans-unit.target: Registration

trans-unit.source: Registration is the act of extracting data asset metadata from a data source and copying it to the Azure Data Catalog service.
trans-unit.target: Registration is the act of extracting data asset metadata from a data source and copying it to the Azure Data Catalog service.

trans-unit.source: Data assets that have been registered can then be annotated and discovered.
trans-unit.target: Data assets that have been registered can then be annotated and discovered.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.target: [What is Azure Data Catalog?](data-catalog-what-is-data-catalog.md) - This article provides an overview of the Azure Data Catalog service, the value it provides, and the scenarios it supports.

trans-unit.source: [Get started with Azure Data Catalog](data-catalog-get-started.md) - This article provides an end-to-end tutorial that shows you how to use Azure Data Catalog for data source discovery.
trans-unit.target: [Get started with Azure Data Catalog](data-catalog-get-started.md) - This article provides an end-to-end tutorial that shows you how to use Azure Data Catalog for data source discovery.

trans-unit.target: test
